definition[0]: to order a product to be supplied again
example[0]: Could you reorder more of this fabric?
definition[1]: to change the way that things are ordered or arranged
definition[2]: to order more of a product, usually because there is none left
example[2]: Buyers in the clothing trade are reordering the most popular items heavily.
example[3]: The video rental company initially ordered 80,000 copies, but reordered three times to keep pace with demand.
